result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven C. Poler III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant must obtain GED.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns except for the purpose of employment.

The defendant must attend anger management program and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must enroll in parenting plan course and follow through with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
All other conditions the same as count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1

All costs and or restitution to be taken from any prison wages or accounts at the maximum amount. Any amounts not paid from prision wages/accounts will become condition of extended supervision.
Concurrent with: Count 9 and 13CF181 & 14CF87

Same conditions as counts 1 & 3.
Concurrent with: 1 & 3

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven C. Poler III

records.addlTxt:
02:49 PM Defendant Steven C. Poler appears in person, in custody from FC jail with attorney Breanna Magallones.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video. Called 13CF181, 14CF87 and 15CF47. State here for SEHR. Magallones has received revocation packet, reviewed with Poler and states no inaccuracies. State notes no inaccuracies or errors. Court notices DOC did not make a recommendation in one of the cases. State is recommending a total of 6 years of initial confinement and 6 years of extended supervision. On 13CF181 - count 2 - 9 years consisting of 4 years of initial incarceration followed by 5 years of extended supervision. In case 14CF87 -  count 1 - 3 years consisting of 2 years on initial incarceration followed by 1 year of extended supervision, concurrent to 15CF47 but consecutive to 13CF181. In 15CF47 - counts 3 & 9 - 3 years consisting of 2 years of initial incarceration followed by 1 year of extended supervision, concurrent to each other but consecutive to case 13CF181. Believes count one in 15CF47 that the court mentioned, defendant may have been discharged on that count already (only probation). Court reviews revocation summary and agrees, only revoked on counts 3 & 9. State makes statement, recites criminal history, asks court to follow recommendation, believes there are 584 days credit and confirms victim rights have been complied with. Magallones makes statement, asking for lower amount of time, notes state is asking for more time than the DOC recommendation which the are asking for on 15CF47 - 2 years of incarceration and 1 year of extended supervision. In 13CF181 - 4 years of incarceration and 2 years of extended supervision. In 14CF87 - 2 years of incarceration and 1 year of extended supervision. Asks for non consecutive sentence, has substantial restitution which he intends to pay, asks to make him eligible for programming for reasons as stated on the record, Magallones is asking for a total sentence of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of extended supervision and asking for all cases to run concurrent. Court questions restitution. Magallones makes statement in regards to restitution and paying it through a longer time of extended supervision. Poler makes statement, remorseful. Court - has reviewed revocation packet, considered all statements of parties, makes statement and sentences to the following: 
15CF47 - Counts 3 & 9 - imposes 3 years of imprisonment, consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 1 year of extended supervision, concurrent to each other - gives credit of 200 days, any remaining costs on this case.
13CF181 - Count 2 - imposes 9 years of imprisonment consisting of 4 years of incarceration followed by 5 years of extended supervision, concurrent to cases 14CF87 and 15CF47, gives 204 days of credit, any remaining costs on this case.
14CF87 - Count 1 - imposes 3 years of imprisonment, consisting of 2 years of initial confinement, followed by 1 year of extended supervision, concurrent to 15CF47 - 589 days credit - pay restitution and costs that has not been paid. All costs and restitution is to be taken from any prison wages or accounts at the maximum amount authorized, any amounts not paid in prison will become condition of extended supervision. Court does not make him eligible for any programming. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 9, 2021 at 02:30 pm.

09:25 AM Defendant Steven C. Poler in court with attorney Attorney Breanna Magallones.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 13CF181, 14CF87 and 15CF47. State - set for SEHR on each case, believes there will be a request for adjournment. Magallones just received summary yesterday, has not been able to review with client, would like time to go over the revocation packet and asks for an adjournment. Court will allow adjournment, sets all three cases for September 9, 2021 at 2:30 PM. Court notices there may be victims in cases. State will check. Court explains may not be in courthouse, explains where the court maybe held and advises Poler of his right to appear in person.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven C. Poler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:24 PM State - has resolution, has complied with victim notification requirements, no restitution. Counts 1, 3 & 9 defendant would plead guilty to counts 1, 3 & 9. Remaining counts DRI. Sentence of probation for 3 years, court costs only on each count, conditions of probation: AODA with follow thru, anger management, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns except for employment purposes only, obtain full time emplyoment/schooling, must complete parenting class. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1, 3 & 9. Court dismisses counts 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10 & 11. Court goes over plea questionaire and finds defendant has freely, volunatarily and inteligently entered his plea and right to trial. Court accepts plea and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement. Burns makes final statement. Polar makes statement - remorseful. Proceed to sentencing. Counts 1, 3 & 9 - with hold sentence and place on probation for a period of 3 years with conditions of: costs on each count, AODA with follow through, comeplete anger mangement and parenting plan course and follow through, no possession or constumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns except for employment purposes, must obtain GED, full time employment or schooling, to run concurrent to any probation currently serving. Advises of voting rights, firearm restrictions and right to appeal. Advises of DNA statutes and defendant must provide DNA sample. Adjourned.

Defendant Steven C. Poler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:22 AM. State - here for PH and believe it is a waiver. Court has been handed the waiver of PH form. Court begins collaquey regarding waiving the PH. Poler has some confusion in regards to waiving the PH. Recess to allow Burns/Poler to discuss the waiver (10:24 AM). Recalled at 10:42 AM with same appearances. Burns - will be waiving the PH. Poler agrees. Court goes thru waiver of PH form, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint.  Burns has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with Sheena Tuckwab.

Defendant Steven C. Poler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:13 PM. Also called 15CF47, 14CF87 and 15CM27. State - 15CF47 - here for INIT and other matters are all resolved. 15CF47 - Burns and Poler have complaint, waives reading of it, set for PH, requests signature bond for stated reasons. State - no objections. Court - bond - modify bond to $2000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no contact with Sheena Tuckwab, sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.

No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Sheena Tuckwab.
